pageContext.claim: “We have to stop drugs and crime and criminals and human trafficking. And we have to stop all of those things that a strong wall will stop. I could call it a barrier, but I think I don't have to do that so much anymore. We'll call it whatever we want. But the point is that we have to have a stoppage. Billions and billions of dollars of illicit things are pouring through our border.”
pageContext.analysis: There is little evidence that "billions and billions of dollars of illicit things" would be halted by Trump's border wall. Both drugs and human trafficking mostly take place at legal ports of entry.
